title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB:
When creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in BIRT report designer and entering an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999,' the software accepts the invalid value. As a result, the report definition includes the following parameter:
<parameters>
  <scalarparameter name='dateParam1'>
    <property name='dataType' dateTime />
    <property name='allowBlank' false />
    <property name='format' Unformatted />
    <property name='controlType' textbox />
    <expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression>
  </scalarparameter>
</parameters>
EB:
The software should behave as follows:
(1) The model should store a 'dateTime' type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss) which is locale-independent, ensuring portability.
(2) The date value should be validated by the user interface (UI) or model, and if the input is an invalid date, the software should reject it and provide an error message.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime.'
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string like '55/66/9999.'
4. Observe that the software accepts this invalid value and generates the problematic parameter definition as mentioned in the observed behavior.
